market_summary: XRP down 0.68% to $1.33 amid extreme fear (F&G: 8). ETF outflows continue with -$7.8K daily, -$5.5M weekly as macro stress persists.
thesis_pulse: SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond launch with XRP rewards validates Japan adoption thesis progression. ETF outflows decelerated significantly (-$7.8K daily vs previous -$5.5M weekly pace). RLUSD circulation steady at $1.56B (31% to kill switch). Extreme fear (F&G: 8) creating institutional hesitancy despite positive adoption signals. XRPL metrics feed down (403 error) limits infrastructure assessment.

stress_assessment.interpretation: Extreme fear index at 8 indicates broad market capitulation. USD/JPY at 154.82 approaching critical 155 threshold. JGB yields at 2.24% well above critical 2.0% level signals persistent BOJ credibility crisis.

scorecard_updates.reasoning: SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards represents material institutional integration advancement beyond previous favorable signals

alerts.message: SBI Holdings launches ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards - validates Japan institutional thesis
XRPL metrics feed down (HTTP 403) - infrastructure monitoring compromised
ETF outflows decelerated significantly from -$5.5M weekly to -$7.8K daily

etf_analysis: ETF outflows decelerated dramatically from -$5.5M weekly to -$7.8K daily, suggesting selling pressure easing. All major funds (Bitwise, Franklin, 21Shares) flat with only Canary showing modest outflow.
macro_analysis: USD/JPY at 154.82 nearing critical 155 stress threshold while JGB yields at 2.24% remain well above crisis level. Extreme fear at 8 indicates broad market capitulation despite improving flow dynamics.

events_draft.title: SBI Holdings Launches ¥10B Blockchain Bond With XRP Rewards
events_draft.expanded: Major Japanese financial institution SBI Holdings issues ¥10B security token bond with XRP rewards, representing significant institutional integration advancement in Japanese market per thesis framework.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: JGB yields at 2.24% indicate persistent credibility crisis while USD/JPY approaches 155 critical threshold.
Brent at $69.77 suggests Hormuz tensions contained but dual carrier group presence maintains elevated baseline risk.
Section 122 tariffs continue with ~145 days remaining on 150-day emergency authorization.
10% global tariffs under Section 122 emergency powers maintaining trade friction baseline through mid-July.
No immediate escalation signals though Russia-Iran-China military coordination in Hormuz continues.

energy_interpretation: Brent crude at $69.77 below elevated ($85+) and critical ($100+) thresholds indicates Hormuz tensions contained for now. However, Japan's energy import dependency combined with weakening yen (154.82 approaching 155) creates feedback loop pressure on trade deficit and BOJ credibility. Rising JGB yields at 2.24% reflect this compounding stress dynamic.
thesis_pulse_assessment: SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards validates Japan institutional thesis acceleration. ETF outflows decelerated from -$5.5M weekly to -$7.8K daily suggesting selling pressure easing. RLUSD steady at $1.56B (31% to $5B kill switch). Extreme fear at 8 creates near-term headwinds but adoption momentum underlying remains intact. Infrastructure monitoring compromised by XRPL metrics outage.
stress_interpretation: Composite stress elevated at 75/100 driven by extreme fear index at 8 and macro pressures. USD/JPY at 154.82 approaches critical 155 threshold while JGB yields at 2.24% remain well above 2.0% crisis level. Energy markets stable but Japanese fiscal stress feedback loop persists.

bear_case.score_reasoning: Extreme fear at 8 and sustained ETF outflows indicate institutional confidence remains fragile despite SBI adoption signals. Risk pressure easing from previous 32 as outflow velocity decelerated.
